cover.headline: Why alcohol makes you hungry and gain
cover.subtitle: The hormones behind your cravings—and how sobriety resets them

slides.title: How Alcohol Hijacks Hunger
items: Ghrelin (the hunger hormone) spikes → constant background cravings
Leptin (your fullness signal) drops → eating more without feeling satisfied
Reward pathways activate → food tastes better, portions grow larger

slides.title: Why The Weight Sticks Around
items: Fat oxidation stops → your body burns alcohol first, stores the rest
Empty calories add up → 150-300 calories per drink, none satisfying
Cortisol rises → stress hormones direct fat straight to your belly

slides.title: What Changes When You Quit
items: Weeks 1-2: Blood sugar stabilizes, ghrelin signaling calms down
Weeks 2-8: Leptin sensitivity returns, satiety feels real again
Months 3+: Fat burning resumes, measurable weight loss begins

end.saveLine: Save this if you're tired of battling cravings and the scale
end.shareLine: Share with someone who can't figure out why they're gaining weight
end.closer: Your hunger hormones can reset—give them time
